greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular table, where the n-th row consists of numbers 0..(n!-1).
comment: Used for computing A030298: a(n) tells the zero-based ranking of the n-th permutation in A030298 (A030299(n)) in the lexicographical ordering of all finite permutations of the same size.
link: A. Karttunen, The rows 1..7 of the irregular table, flattened.
example: Rows of this irregular table begin as:
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 18 2012
